alert.note: Alert for Dutchess; Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut and east central New York, including the following counties, in northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield. In east central New York, Dutchess and Ulster. * WHEN...Until 345 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain over areas that received significant rainfall over the past 24 hours. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Poughkeepsie, Beacon, New Paltz, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Wallkill, Hyde Park, Milton, Plattekill, Pleasant Valley, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Kent, Sharon, Highland, Pine Plains, Fishkill, Red Hook, Millbrook and Canaan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
